intro: Triphylloides nervosa, commonly known as the veined triphylloids, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves with distinct venation patterns. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature five petals, often in shades of pink or white. Triphylloides nervosa is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
